meanings.definition: To sublating something means to take away or remove it.
meanings.sent1: She sublating the old furniture from the room.
meanings.sent2: The teacher sublating the incorrect answers from the test.
meanings.sent3: He tried sublating the noisy distractions during the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The magician sublating the rabbit from the hat.
meanings.sent5: The wind sublating the fallen leaves from the ground.

meanings.definition: Sublating can also refer to the act of replacing or superseding something.
meanings.sent1: The new technology sublating the outdated machines in the factory.
meanings.sent2: She sublating her old phone with a brand new one.
meanings.sent3: The superhero sublating the villain's evil plans.
meanings.sent4: The rising sun sublating the darkness of the night.
meanings.sent5: The fresh coat of paint sublating the worn-out look of the house.

meanings.definition: Sublating can also mean to elevate or raise something to a higher level.
meanings.sent1: The promotion sublating her position in the company.
meanings.sent2: He sublating his performance by practicing every day.
meanings.sent3: The balloon sublating higher and higher into the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness sublating the mood of the room.
meanings.sent5: The music sublating the spirits of the audience.
